marketNews.title: Acquisition Plans: TOWR-DATA; BBTN-Bank Victoria Syariah
marketNews.content:
There are 2 planned acquisition actions announced today, Monday (20/1). First, Sarana Menara Nusantara ($TOWR) through its business entity, PT Iforte Solusi Infotek (Iforte), plans to acquire ~40% of shares in Remala Abadi ($DATA). Second, Bank Tabungan Negara ($BBTN) plans to acquire 100% of PT Bank Victoria Syariah shares. Some details regarding these two acquisitions are as follows: 
- TOWR Acquires DATA 
  TOWR through its business entity, Iforte, announced a plan to acquire ~40% of DATA shares from Verah Wahyudi Singgih Wong and Jimmi Anka. The total transaction value has not been announced. The share purchase agreement was signed on December 23, 2024. The objective of this acquisition is for business development and strengthening the group's position in the telecommunications infrastructure sector. After this transaction, TOWR through Iforte will become the new controller of DATA, leading to a mandatory tender offer.
- BBTN Acquires PT Bank Victoria Syariah 
  BBTN announced plans to acquire 100% of PT Bank Victoria Syariah shares as part of the spin-off of the company's Sharia business unit, BTN Syariah. The acquisition value has not been announced, while the financing will use BBTN's internal funding sources. The acquisition is expected to be completed in May 2025, with BBTN's General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS) planned for March 14, 2025. PT Bank Victoria Syariah itself is an entity directly owned approximately 80.2% by Victoria Investama ($VICO) and approximately 19.8% by Bank Victoria International ($BVIC). Furthermore, VICO owns approximately 44.2% of BVIC shares, resulting in VICO's total direct and indirect ownership in PT Bank Victoria Syariah amounting to approximately 89%.

At the closing of the market today, all five stocks closed higher, with DATA +25%, TOWR +0.76%, BBTN +0.92%, VICO +8.55%, and BVIC +19.35%.

Key Takeaway

BBTN's acquisition of PT Bank Victoria Syariah aligns with our forecast written in Stockbit Commentary in July 2024. We assess that the impact and subsequent sentiment from both acquisitions will depend on the announcement of the acquisition value, whether it is done at an expensive or cheap valuation. We assess that the stocks that will be more affected by the short-term sentiment are DATA, which will be acquired by TOWR, and VICO as the controller of PT Bank Victoria Syariah.

*This article was previously released on Monday (20/1) morning in Stockbit Commentary TOWR and BBTN.

marketNews.title: ESDM Ministry Targets 2025 Coal DMO at 239.7 Million Tons
marketNews.content: The Director at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM), Julian Ambassadur Shiddiq, stated on Friday (17/1) that the domestic market obligation (DMO) target for coal in 2025 reaches 239.7 million tons, an increase of +32.2% compared to the 2024 DMO target and +14.2% higher than the 2024 DMO realization. Julian stated that this DMO target is based on the results of a multilateral meeting with coal industry players and considers the Electricity Supply Business Plan (RUPTL) for 2025. According to the Executive Director of the Indonesian Mining Association, Hendra Sinadia, the addition to the DMO volume indicates that the government will target an increase in domestic coal production and consumption. Hendra also reiterated his request to the government to evaluate the DMO price for PLN, which has remained unchanged for several years at 70 US dollars per ton.

marketNews.title: Minister of ESDM Bahlil Denies Issues of Nickel Production Cuts This Year
marketNews.content: Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Friday (17/1) that the government does not yet plan to cut nickel ore production in 2025. Nevertheless, Bahlil mentioned that the government wants to maintain a balance between demand relative to the work plan and budget (RKAB) and industry capacity to maintain nickel prices. Bahlil gave an example: if a company applies for nickel production of 20 million tons, the government will only issue a permit for 60% of that amount, with the remaining 40% having to be absorbed from local businesses. Previously, Bloomberg reported in December 2024 that the Indonesian government was considering cutting the nickel ore production quota from 272 million tons in 2024 to 150 million tons in 2025.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Wants More Independent Power Plants Under New Energy Plan
marketNews.content: Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Monday (20/1) that approximately 60% of the additional electricity capacity plan up to 71 GW in 2025-2034 will come from the private sector. Meanwhile, the government will focus on transmission for new and renewable energy (EBT) power plants, with PLN planning to build a transmission network spanning 48,000 ckm or equivalent to 8,000 km. Last week, the Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, stated that 70% of the additional 71 GW electricity capacity in 2025-2034 is targeted to come from EBT. Bahlil mentioned that Indonesia currently has a total installed electricity capacity of 101 GW, with EBT only contributing about 15% to the energy mix.

marketNews.title: Government Plans to Stop Gas Exports to Meet Domestic Energy Needs
marketNews.content: Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Monday (20/1) that the government plans to halt gas exports to meet the continuously increasing domestic energy needs. Bahlil mentioned that national gas needs are projected to reach 1,471 BBtud in 2025 and are predicted to keep increasing to reach 2,659 BBtud by 2034. Bahlil emphasized that the government will prioritize the utilization of domestic gas to meet domestic energy needs, including supporting industrial downstreaming programs.

marketNews.title: National Nutrition Agency Needs Additional Budget of IDR 100 Trillion to Target 82.9 Million Beneficiaries in 2025
marketNews.content: The Head of the National Nutrition Agency, Dadan Hindayana, stated on Friday (17/1) that President Prabowo Subianto wants to accelerate the distribution of the free lunch program and target as many as 82.9 million beneficiaries this year. To achieve this beneficiary target, Dadan mentioned that they require an additional budget of up to 100 trillion rupiah. Dadan stated that the acceleration of the free nutritious meal program requires budget adjustments, considering the 2024 APBN only allocated 71 trillion rupiah for the free nutritious meal program for 15-17.5 million recipients.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Ministry of Trade Welcomes WTO Ruling in Palm Oil Dispute with EU
marketNews.content: Minister of Trade, Budi Santoso, stated that the Indonesian government welcomes the decision by the World Trade Organization (WTO) panel which ruled in favor of Indonesia in the palm oil dispute with the European Union. The Ministry of Trade also stated that the European Union will be forced to adjust its policies to comply with the WTO ruling, adding that the Indonesian government will closely monitor changes in EU regulations to meet the WTO recommendations. This dispute originated when Indonesia sued the European Union in 2019, following the EU's decision that palm oil-based diesel would not be considered biofuel due to its connection with deforestation, and its use as a transportation fuel would be phased out between 2023-2030. Although the WTO deemed the logic underlying the EU's measures to limit greenhouse gas emissions as legitimate, they found flaws in the way the EU prepared, issued, and implemented its actions.

marketNews.title: DPR Legislation Committee Opens Opportunity for Universities and SMEs to Manage Mines
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the DPR Legislation Committee on Monday (20/1) proposed that universities and SMEs be allowed to manage mines. This proposal is part of the discussion on the Draft Law (RUU) for the third amendment to Law No. 4/2009 concerning Mineral and Coal.

tickerNews.title: PANI: Marketing Sales +156% YoY in 2024, Achieved Target
tickerNews.content: $PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua recorded marketing sales of 1.34 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (-3% QoQ, +120% YoY). This result brought total marketing sales for 2024 to 6.01 trillion rupiah (+156% YoY), equivalent to 100.3% of the target of 6 trillion rupiah. The land plot segment contributed 48% of the total 2024 marketing sales, followed by the residential segment (33%) and commercial segment (19%). PANI's subsidiary, Bangun Kosambi Sukses ($CBDK), recorded marketing sales contribution of 504 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+16% QoQ), resulting in CBDK's marketing sales for 2024 reaching 2.1 trillion rupiah (-6% YoY) and equivalent to 82% of the 2024 target of 2.6 trillion rupiah. PANI stated that the decrease in CBDK's marketing sales during 2024 was pressured by the residential segment (-21% YoY) and commercial segment (-69% YoY) in line with uncertainty regarding the 12% VAT policy and the slow decline in mortgage interest rates.

tickerNews.title: ACES: Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) of +7% YoY in December 2024
tickerNews.content: $ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +7% YoY in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: +6% YoY, December 2023: +11.6% YoY). This result brought SSSG throughout 2024 to +8.8% YoY (vs. 2023: +8.1% YoY), exceeding management's 2024 guidance of +8%. The highest SSSG in December 2024 was recorded outside Java (+9.7% YoY), followed by Java outside Jakarta (+6.2% YoY) and Jakarta (+3.4% YoY). ACES also recorded a total of 245 outlets as of the end of 2024 (vs. 2023: 233 outlets). Meanwhile, ACES plans to complete the transformation of all ACES outlets to AZKO by the end of 1Q25.

tickerNews.title: HOKI: Announces Rice Sales Cooperation Worth IDR 130 Billion
tickerNews.content: $HOKI: Buyung Poetra Sembada announced a rice sales cooperation worth 130 billion rupiah with PT Gurih Mitra Perkasa for 1 year. The value of this cooperation is equivalent to 9.2% of HOKI's 9M24 annualized revenue.

tickerNews.title: HUMI: Allocates Capex of USD 39.57 Million in 2025 for Fleet and Operational Strengthening
tickerNews.content: $HUMI: Humpuss Maritim Internasional announced that the company is allocating a capex of USD 39.57 million in 2025, equivalent to 645 billion rupiah based on an exchange rate of 16,300 rupiah per US dollar (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 802.5 billion rupiah). This fund is intended for strengthening a number of fleets and operational systems. In 2025, HUMI targets acquiring 10 ship units, consisting of 4 chemical and oil tanker units, 5 tugboats, 1 platform supply vessel unit, and LNG logistic support.

tickerNews.title: WIKA: New Contract Value in 2024 Reached IDR 20.65 Trillion
tickerNews.content: $WIKA: Wijaya Karya Corporate Secretary, Mahendra Vijaya, stated that the company recorded a new contract value of 20.65 trillion rupiah during 2024 (-29% YoY), equivalent to 55.8% of the 2024 target of 37 trillion rupiah. The infrastructure and building segment contributed 42% of the new contract value, followed by industry (32%), energy and industrial plant (20%), and property (6%).

tickerNews.title: SMRA: Subsidiary Acquires Control in PT Duta Wahana Asri
tickerNews.content: $SMRA: Summarecon Agung, through its subsidiary, PT Summarecon Property Development, purchased 2.86 million shares of PT Duta Wahana Asri for 2.86 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Summarecon Property Development will become the new controlling shareholder of PT Duta Wahana Asri with a 51% share ownership.

tickerNews.title: MTLA: Targets Marketing Sales of IDR 2 Trillion in 2025
tickerNews.content: $MTLA: Metropolitan Land Director, Olivia Surodjo, stated that the company is targeting marketing sales of around 2 trillion rupiah in 2025. Olivia also told Kontan that MTLA successfully achieved its 2024 marketing sales target of 1.9 trillion rupiah (+7.3% YoY).

tickerNews.title: SOLA: Subsidiary Obtains Chipseal Road Project Contract from ITMG Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: $SOLA: Xolare RCR Energy, through its subsidiary, PT Aplikasi Bitumen Indonesia, obtained a chipseal road project operation cooperation contract from a subsidiary of Indo Tambangraya Megah ($ITMG), PT Trubaindo Coal Mining. The total value of the contract reaches approximately 417 billion rupiah, with the portion of the contract value obtained by PT Aplikasi Bitumen Indonesia reaching approximately 166.8 billion rupiah. SOLA stated that this contract has the potential to increase the company's revenue significantly.
